root.name: Never7: The End of Infinity
root.description: OverviewNever 7: The End of Infinity is the second entry in KID's Infinity series which was originally released for the Sega Dreamcast in 2000. The game was later ported to the PC in 2001, the PlayStation 2 in 2003, and finally the PSP in 2009. Never 7 is sometimes considered to be the first installment of the Infinity series since the game includes a remake of the "Cure Izumi" scenario from the series' first entry, Infinity. Never 7: The End of Infinity was never officially released in English but a visual novel translation group named Lemnisca Translations released an English patch for the PC version of the game on August 17, 2012.
